events.title: Completion of the Spanish Civil War
events.description: Madrid falls to the forces of Francisco Franco, effectively ending the Spanish Civil War with a Nationalist victory.
events.significance: Marked the establishment of Franco’s dictatorship in Spain, which lasted until his death in 1975.

events.title: Tenerife Airport Disaster
events.description: Two Boeing 747 jumbo jets collide on the runway at Los Rodeos Airport (now Tenerife North Airport), resulting in 583 fatalities.
events.significance: Remains the deadliest accident in aviation history, leading to significant improvements in aircraft communication and safety procedures.

events.title: Citizenship Stripped from Jews in Nazi Germany
events.description: The Nazi regime issues the Law for the Restoration of the Professional Civil Service, which excludes Jews and political opponents from civil service positions.
events.significance: Early step in the systemic disenfranchisement and persecution that led to the Holocaust.

events.title: First Surrealist Manifesto Released
events.description: André Breton publishes the first Surrealist Manifesto, defining the Surrealist movement in art and literature.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of Surrealism, which had a profound influence on modern art and literature.

events.title: Cyprus Convention Signed
events.description: Britain and the Ottoman Empire sign an agreement granting Britain administrative control over Cyprus while the island remains officially Ottoman territory.
events.significance: Strengthened British influence in the Mediterranean, impacting regional politics for decades.
